meanings.definition: A unit of power equal to one trillion watts.
meanings.sent1: The new solar power plant generates one terawatt of electricity every hour.
meanings.sent2: The country's energy consumption is expected to reach one terawatt by the end of the year.
meanings.sent3: It would take a terawatt of energy to power a spaceship to the moon and back.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room with the brightness of a terawatt bulb.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm unleashed a terawatt of energy in a spectacular display of lightning.

meanings.definition: A terawatt-hour, a unit of energy equal to one trillion watt-hours.
meanings.sent1: The city's power grid consumed a terawatt of energy during the heatwave.
meanings.sent2: The wind farm produces one terawatt of energy in a month.
meanings.sent3: The battery pack had enough power to last for a terawatt-hour of continuous use.
meanings.sent4: The concert hall was filled with a terawatt-hour of excitement during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The dam released a terawatt-hour of energy, lighting up the entire valley.
